title: Top Places to visit in Suryapet, Telangana
content:
Suryapet is a city and the district headquarters of Suryapet district in the Indian state of Telangana. It is a municipality and the headquarters of Suryapet mandal in Suryapet revenue division. The Government of India announced Suryapet to be developed under the Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) scheme. Suryapet has been awarded the "Cleanest city" in South India by the Ministry of Urban development in Swachh Survekshan 2017. It is also known as "Gateway of Telangana". It is located about 134 kilometres (83 mi) east of the state capital, Hyderabad and also it is located about 138 kilometres (86 mi) West of the Andhra Pradesh state capital, Amaravathi.

 

Demographics

 

As of 2011 India census, Suryapet had an urban metropolitan population of 115,250 Suryapet is the most populous city in Suryapet district. Apart from the city population, it has a floating population of approximately 10,000 from the neighbouring villages daily. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Suryapet has an average literacy rate of 84.88%, higher than the national average of 74.04.%: male literacy is 91.18%, and female literacy is 78.74%. In Suryapet, 11% of the population is under 6 years of age.

 

Governance

Civic administration

 

Suryapet Municipality tractor collecting garbage

Suryapet municipality was constituted in 1952. It was upgraded to Grade–II in 1984, Grade–I on 7 November 1998. The area of the municipality is spread over an area of 54.00 km2 (20.85 sq mi) with 34 wards. The present municipal commissioner is V. Surender and the chairman is Ganduri Pravalika Prakash.

 

Awards

Suryapet Municipality became the first waste-compliant city of India in 2003. It had won Green Leaf Award for Best Garbage Disposal in 2007. Suryapet is the first municipality in the country to receive the (ISO 14001-2004 certificate. Suryapet Municipality has won the HUDCO Award under environmental management category.

 

Education

The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government, aided and private schools, under the School Education Department of the state.

 

The medium of instruction followed by schools are English, Telugu and Urdu.

 

Government Medical College at Suryapet, a first after the formation of new districts in the State

 

Transport

Suryapet Hi-tech Bus station is the fourth largest bus station in Telangana after Hyderabad, Nizamabad and Karimnagar bus stations.

 

There are three bus stations in Suryapet.

 

High-Tech Bus station -Hyderabad, Vijayawada, Bengaluru, Khammam, Visakhapatnam, Rajahmundry, Bhadrachalam, Kakinada, Annavaram, Srikakulam, Eluru, Jaggayyapeta, Machilipatnam, Kothagudem, Madhira, Manugur, Sathupally, Yellandu, Aswaraopeta, Tiruvuru, Gudivada, Amalapuram, Tadepalligudem, Bhimavaram, Palakollu, Razole, Ravulapalem, Guntur, Nizamabad, Tanuku, Nuzvid, Sangareddy buses runs through this bus station.

New bus station - Nalgonda, Secunderabad, Khammam, Warangal, Mahabubabad, Hanamkonda, Karimnagar, Vemulawada, Kodad, Jangaon, Miryalaguda, Srisailam, Piduguralla, Thungathurthy, Neredcherla, Huzurnagar, Thirumalagiri, Atmakur, Thorrur, Nuthankal, Bhongir, Eturnagaram, Mattampally, Mellachervu, Palakeedu, Garidepally, Penpahad, Janpahad, Maddirala, Gorantla, Laxma Puram, Solipet buses run through this bus station.

Old bus station- Near by village buses run through this bus station.

 

Major City

Suryapet

Major Towns

Kodad

Huzurnagar

Neredcherla

Thirumalagiri

Notable Places in District

Lingamanthula Swamy temple- 5 km from Suryapet

Chennakeshava Swamy temple,Pillalamarri-6 km from Suryapet

Dandu Maisamma temple-12 km from Suryapet

Sri Undrugonda Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy temple,Undrugonda-13 km from Suryapet

Musi Reservior-27 km from Suryapet

Arvapalli Dargah-30 km from Suryapet

Phanigiri Buddhist Site-42 km from Suryapet

Janpahad Darga,Janpahad-52 km from Suryapet

Swayambu Shambhu Lingeshwara Temple,Mellacheruvu-63 km from Suryapet

Mattapalli Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple,Mattapalli-80 km from Suryapet

Administrative divisions

The district has three revenue divisions of Suryapet, Kodad and Huzurnagar . It is sub-divided into 23 mandals. Amoy kumar is the present collector of the district.

 

Mandals

S.No. Suryapet revenue division Kodad revenue division Huzurnagar revenue division

1SuryapetChilkurGaridepally

2ChivvemlaAnanthagiriHuzurnagar

3MotheyKodadNereducherla

4JajireddygudemMunagalaMattampally

5NuthankalNadigudemMellachervu

6PenpahadPalakeedu

7 Athmakur(S) Mallareddygudem

8Thirumalagiri

9Thungathurthy

10Nagaram

11Maddirala

Notable Personalities

Tollywood actors Kanta Rao, Prabhakar Reddy, Venu Madhav are from Suryapet District.

 

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suryapet

recommendations.title: Top Places to visit in Adilabad, Telangana
recommendations.content: Adilabad, a municipality, and the headquarters of Adilabad district, is a city in Adilabad district of the Indian state of Telangana.
